titles.title: O Joyful day O glorious hour

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O Joyful day! O glorious hour! When Jesus, by almighty power, Revived and left the grave; In all His works behold Him great, Before, almighty to create, Before, almighty to create, Almighty now to save.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: The First-begotten from the dead, He's risen now, His people's Head, And thus their life's secure; And if, like Him, they yield their breath, Like Him they'll burst the bonds of death, Like Him they'll burst the bonds of death, Their resurrection sure.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Why should His people,then, be sad? None have such reason to be glad As those redeemed to God: Jesus, the mighty Saviour, lives, To them eternal life He gives, To them eternal life He gives, The purchase of His blood.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Then let our gladsome praise resound, And let us in His work abound, Whose blessed name is Love; We're sure our labour's not in vain, For we with Him ere long shall reign- For we with Him ere long shall reign- With Jesus dwell above.
